abstract: David H Petraeus is keeping a lower profile two years after extramarital affair cost him his job as CIA director; he is now a partner in New York private equity firm KKR & Company and has served as White House adviser and college teacher; Petraeus could face prison if federal authorities pursue indictment against him for disclosing classified information to his biographer, and then lover, Paula Broadwell.
lead_paragraph: Facing an inquiry that could send him to prison, David H. Petraeus, the former C.I.A. chief, keeps a lower profile as White House adviser, college teacher and partner at a private equity firm.

headline.main: After Scandal, Petraeus Stays Under Radar, but Not Out of the Spotlight
headline.print_headline: After Scandal, Petraeus Stays Under Radar, but Not Out of the Spotlight

snippet: Facing an inquiry that could send him to prison, David H. Petraeus, the former C.I.A. chief, keeps a lower profile as White House adviser, college teacher and partner at a private equity firm.
